DataElement.preferredName: Abdomen and Thoracic Visceral Organs Soft Tissue Sarcoma AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Abdomen And Thoracic Visceral Organs Soft Tissue Sarcoma Clinical T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Having to do with the chest._Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Abdomen And Thoracic Visceral Organ Soft Tissue Sarcoma
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Having to do with the chest.:Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.:A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.:A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Concepts.longName: Abdomen
Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

Concepts.longName: And
Concepts.definition: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Concepts.longName: Thoracic
Concepts.definition: Having to do with the chest.

Concepts.longName: Visceral
Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.

Concepts.longName: Organ
Concepts.definition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma
Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: TL released; 2/24/22.  4-4-19 created for AJCC Ed. 8; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Abdomen and Thoracic Visceral Organs American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system does not apply to desmoplastic small round cell tumor, epithelioid hemangioendothelioma, inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, perivascular epithelioid cell tumor (PEComa), solitary fibrous tumor, gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST), uterine leiomyosarcoma, and retroperitoneal leiomyosarcoma.  This is a new classification system and there is no recommended prognostic stage grouping at this time. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs with multifocal involvement (more than five sites). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs with multifocal involvement (more than five sites). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the abdomen and thoracic visceral organs with tumor invading serosa or visceral peritoneum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

This classification system does not apply to desmoplastic small round cell tumor, epithelioid hemangioendothelioma, inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, perivascular epithelioid cell tumor (PEComa), solitary fibrous tumor, gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST), uterine leiomyosarcoma, and retroperitoneal leiomyosarcoma.  This is a new classification system and there is no recommended prognostic stage grouping at this time. (from AJCC 8th Ed.):A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

This classification system does not apply to desmoplastic small round cell tumor, epithelioid hemangioendothelioma, inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor, perivascular epithelioid cell tumor (PEComa), solitary fibrous tumor, gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST), uterine leiomyosarcoma, and retroperitoneal leiomyosarcoma.
